com.here.sdk.mapviewlite

Class MapMarkerImageStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.NativeBase
      • com.here.sdk.mapviewlite.MapMarkerImageStyle

  • public final class MapMarkerImageStyle
extends NativeBase

    A style that can be applied to map images to determine their appearance when displayed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MapMarkerImageStyle()
      Creates a new style for map marker image that when unchanged and applied, will result in a non-flat marker displayed at its original size.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Gets the rotation angle at which to draw the image, in degrees.
      float getScale()
      Gets the scale of an image to be displayed.
      boolean isFlat()
      Indicates if the marker is flat.

      Sets the transparency of an image.

      Sets an anchor point from which to draw an image.
      void setAngle(float degrees)
      Sets the rotation angle at which to draw the image, specified in degrees.
      void setFlat(boolean flat)
      When set to true, puts a marker on the ground in 3D space which responds to 3D camera movement accordingly.
      void setScale(float scale)
      Sets the scale of the image to be displayed.

      • MapMarkerImageStyle

        public MapMarkerImageStyle()

        Creates a new style for map marker image that when unchanged and applied, will result in a non-flat marker displayed at its original size.

    • Method Detail

      • setFlat

        public void setFlat(boolean flat)

        When set to true, puts a marker on the ground in 3D space which responds to 3D camera movement accordingly.

        Parameters:
        flat -

        Flat value.

      • isFlat

        public boolean isFlat()

        Indicates if the marker is flat.

        Returns:

        Returns true if the marker is flat and false - otherwise.

      • setAnchorPoint

        public void setAnchorPoint(@NonNull
                           Anchor2D anchorPoint)

        Sets an anchor point from which to draw an image. This is calculated from a floating point number between 0.0 and 1.0, with 0.0 representing the left or top of the image and 1.0 representing the right or bottom of the image. The default value used is 0.5, 0,5, causing the image to be centered over the location (latitude and longitude) at which the image's associated map marker is placed. Values outside this range can also be used, with positive values moving the image to the left or upwards, and negative values moving the image towards the right or downwards.

        Parameters:
        anchorPoint -

        An Anchor2D relative to the top-left corner of the map image. The horizontal value represents the x axis and the vertical value represents the y axis.

      • getAnchorPoint

        @NonNull
public Anchor2D getAnchorPoint()

        Gets the anchor point from which to draw an image.

        Returns:

        Anchor point of an image.

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(float degrees)

        Sets the rotation angle at which to draw the image, specified in degrees. By default this is 0. Setting it to a negative value causes the image to rotate in an anti clockwise direction and setting it to a positive value causes the image to rotate in a clockwise direction.

        Parameters:
        degrees -

        The angle at which to draw the image.

      • getAngle

        public float getAngle()

        Gets the rotation angle at which to draw the image, in degrees.

        Returns:

        The angle at which to draw the image.

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scale)

        Sets the scale of the image to be displayed. By default, an image is displayed in its actual size, but a normalized scaling value can be set, causing it to be reduced in size (when a scaling value of less than 1.0 is specified) or increased in size (when greater than 1.0 is specified).

        Parameters:
        scale -

        The size of the image, specified as a normalized value.

      • getScale

        public float getScale()

        Gets the scale of an image to be displayed.

        Returns:

        The size of the image, specified as a normalized value.

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha(float alpha)

        Sets the transparency of an image.

        Parameters:
        alpha -

        The alpha value of the image, from 0.0 till 1.0.

      • getAlpha

        public float getAlpha()

        Gets the transparency of an image.

        Returns:

        The alpha value of the image.
